thread.title: Yankees fill GM Brian Cashman's assistant role, reports say
thread.title_full: Yankees fill GM Brian Cashman's assistant role, reports say

author: Ryan Hatch | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Yankees fill GM Brian Cashman's assistant role, reports say
text:
Comments 
The Yankees lost assistant general manager Billy Eppler to the Los Angeles Angels last month but have found a replacement, reports say. (Eppler's L.A.'s new GM.) 
The Boston Globe 's Nick Cafardo first wrote on Twitter Saturday that scout Tim Naehring would receive a major promotion and later reports said he will fill Eppler's role without taking on the same assistant GM title. Meant Tim Naehring is getting a major promotion from Yankees. — Nick Cafardo (@nickcafardo) October 24, 2015 as @nickcafardo reported Tim Naehring will get #Yankees promotion. Can report will fill Billy Eppler Asst GM role without that title — Joel Sherman (@Joelsherman1) October 24, 2015 
Naehring was hired by the Yankees as a scout in 2007. He's said to have played a large part in bringing shortstop Didi Gregorius to the Yankees from the Arizona Diamondbacks last offseason. 
New York, which lost to the Houston Astros in the American League Wild Card game three weeks ago, haven't yet made any big moves this offseason. They fired hitting coach Jeff Pentland and announced last week that right-handed starting pitcher Masahiro Tanaka underwent surgery to remove a bone spur in his pitching elbow. Otherwise, it's been mostly quiet.
